metadata.Title: CVE-2013-1435 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
(1) snmp.php and (2) rrd.php in Cacti before 0.8.8b allows remote attackersto execute arbitrary commands via shell metacharacters in unspecifiedvectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1435` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cacti - 0.8.8b+dfsg-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cacti package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.8.8b+dfsg-5').
